setupPageTabConnectorInstallation.description: The connector installation tab on the setup page

setupPageTabRuntimeInstallation.description: The runtime installation tab on the setup page

setupPageLicenseBase.message: The project is licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. By using, redistributing, or modifying it, you must agree to the license, and the additional clauses provided below. See the LICENSE file in the project repository for the full MPL 2.0 license text.
setupPageLicenseBase.description: The base license notice on the setup page

setupPageLicenseThirdPartyIncluded.message: The project uses additional third-party assets and code:
setupPageLicenseThirdPartyIncluded.description: The included third-party assets and code notice on the setup page

setupPageLicenseLogo.message: The project logo is based on the "Fox SVG Vector" icon and the community-introduced PWA logo, both dedicated to the public domain using CC0.
setupPageLicenseLogo.description: The logo notice on the setup page

setupPageLicenseFirefoxScripts.message: Browser chrome modifications were inspired by and partially derived from the xiaoxiaoflood/firefox-scripts repository on GitHub, licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Detailed information can be found in the respective files.
setupPageLicenseFirefoxScripts.description: The notice for `xiaoxiaoflood/firefox-scripts` on the setup page

setupPageLicenseFirefoxUiFix.message: Browser chrome modifications partially use code derived from the black7375/Firefox-UI-Fix repository on GitHub, licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Detailed information can be found in the respective files.
setupPageLicenseFirefoxUiFix.description: The notice for `black7375/Firefox-UI-Fix` on the setup page

setupPageLicenseFirefoxSource.message: Browser chrome modifications partially use code and icons derived from the original Firefox source, licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Detailed information can be found in the respective files.
setupPageLicenseFirefoxSource.description: The notice for the Firefox source on the setup page

setupPageLicenseMetropolisFont.message: Native programs contain the Metropolis Semi Bold typeface by Chris Simpson, released into the public domain using Unlicense.
setupPageLicenseMetropolisFont.description: The notice for Metropolis Typeface on the setup page

setupPageLicenseBootstrapIcons.message: Windows installer contains Bootstrap Icons, licensed under the MIT License. Detailed license information can be found in the WiX configuration file.
setupPageLicenseBootstrapIcons.description: The notice for Bootstrap Icons on the setup page

setupPageLicenseThirdPartyDownloaded.message: 在用戶首次下載執行環境時，將下載以下的開源軟體：
setupPageLicenseThirdPartyDownloaded.description: The downloaded third-party assets and code notice on the setup page

setupPageLicense7ZipDownloaded.message: 如果尚未下載，下載Windows執行環境時將下載 7-Zip 。 7-Zip項目由Igor Pavlov和 根據GNU LGPL等許可證授予許可。本項目與7-Zip項目或其開發者沒有任何關聯。
setupPageLicense7ZipDownloaded.description: The notice for downloaded 7-Zip on the setup page

setupPageLicenseFirefoxDownloaded.message: Installing the runtime on any system will download the unmodified Mozilla Firefox browser and locally modify it. By using this project, you also agree to the Firefox Privacy Notice. Firefox is licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0. Firefox and the Firefox logo are trademarks of the Mozilla Foundation in the U.S. and other countries. This project is not affiliated with the Mozilla Foundation in any way.
setupPageLicenseFirefoxDownloaded.description: The notice for downloaded Firefox on the setup page

setupPageLicensePrivacyPolicy.message: This extension exchanges personal data (current website and manifest URLs, as well as other PWA details) with the native program when the user initiates the PWA installation. This is necessary in order to correctly obtain and parse the Web Application Manifest and install the PWA. Data are stored on the computer as long as that PWA is installed. No personal data leave the computer or are sent to third parties.
setupPageLicensePrivacyPolicy.description: The privacy policy notice on the setup page

setupPageLicenseLinks.message: You can also read this licence agreement and privacy policy on the AMO page.
setupPageLicenseLinks.description: The links to the licence agreement and privacy policy on AMO on the setup page

setupPageLicenseConsent.message: 如果您不同意上述條款，您將無法使用此擴充套件。在這種情況下，您可以通過下方按鈕卸載。
setupPageLicenseConsent.description: The required consent and uninstallation notice on the setup page

setupPageLicenseUninstallation.message: 如果您不同意這些條款，您將無法使用擴充套件。 擴充套件將被卸載。如果您改變主意，您可以稍后重新下載。
setupPageLicenseUninstallation.description: The dialog displayed when the user declines the license agreement

setupPageLicenseDecline.description: The decline and uninstall button on the setup page

setupPageLicenseAccept.description: The license accept button on the setup page

setupPageConnectorInstallationMain.message: 您需要下載附加程式，以便擴充套件能夠管理和執行網頁應用的獨立執行環境和配置檔案。沒有此程式，擴充套件將無法正常運作。請按照下面的說明進行下載。
setupPageConnectorInstallationMain.description: The main connector installation notice on the setup page

setupPageConnectorInstallationIncompatib.message: 目前下載的程式版本可能與目前版本的擴充套件不相容。您需要更新程式或使用相容版本的擴充套件才能正常執行。
setupPageConnectorInstallationIncompatib.description: The incompatible connector installation notice on the setup page

setupPageRuntimeInstallationAuto.message: This extension also needs a separate Mozilla Firefox runtime where all your Progressive Web App sites will run. Pressing the button below will automatically download the unmodified Mozilla Firefox from the Mozilla servers and locally modify it with the required modifications. You can also check the advanced options below to manually install the runtime.
setupPageRuntimeInstallationAuto.description: The runtime installation notice on the setup page, displayed on platforms where auto installation is supported

setupPageRuntimeInstallationManual.message: This extension also needs a separate Mozilla Firefox runtime where all your Progressive Web App sites will run. However, your platform currently does not support automatic installation of the runtime. Please follow the advanced options below to install it manually.
setupPageRuntimeInstallationManual.description: The runtime installation notice on the setup page, displayed on platforms where auto installation is not supported

setupPageRuntimeInstallation7Zip.message: To install the runtime, you will need 7-Zip installed. Installing the runtime will automatically trigger the 7-Zip installer if needed. This may require accepting User Account Control prompt. You can also manually install 7-Zip or use your existing 7-zip installation. After the runtime is installed, you can delete 7-Zip manually.
setupPageRuntimeInstallation7Zip.description: The runtime installation notice on the setup page, displayed when 7-Zip needs to be installed

setupPageRuntimeInstallationAfter.message: After the runtime is installed, you should be automatically proceeded to the next step. If nothing changes after around 30 seconds, restart the browser.
setupPageRuntimeInstallationAfter.description: The runtime installation notice on the setup page, displayed always

setupPageAdvancedOptionsTitle.description: The advanced runtime installation options toggle on the setup page

setupPageAdvancedOptionsFromArchiveTitle.message: Manually installing Firefox from the archive:
setupPageAdvancedOptionsFromArchiveTitle.description: Instructions for manually installing Firefox from the archive, title

setupPageAdvancedOptionsFromArchiveStep1.message: Download the Firefox archive from your preferred source (for example, from the official downloads page).
setupPageAdvancedOptionsFromArchiveStep1.description: Instructions for manually installing Firefox from the archive, step 1

setupPageAdvancedOptionsFromArchiveStep2.message: Extract the downloaded archive and copy files to the correct directory (see below).
setupPageAdvancedOptionsFromArchiveStep2.description: Instructions for manually installing Firefox from the archive, step 2

setupPageAdvancedOptionsPackageManagerTi.message: Manually installing Firefox using package manager:
setupPageAdvancedOptionsPackageManagerTi.description: Instructions for manually installing Firefox using package manager, title

setupPageAdvancedOptionsPackageManagerSt.message: Install Firefox using your distro's package manager (e.g., <kbd>sudo apt install firefox</kbd>, <kbd>sudo yum install firefox</kbd>, …).
setupPageAdvancedOptionsPackageManagerSt.description: Instructions for manually installing Firefox using package manager, step 1

setupPageAdvancedOptionsPackageManagerSt.message: Copy the installed Firefox files (commonly stored in <kbd>/usr/lib/firefox/</kbd>) to the correct directory (see below).
setupPageAdvancedOptionsPackageManagerSt.description: Instructions for manually installing Firefox using package manager, step 2

setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.message: Installing an alternative Firefox-based browser (for example, LibreWolf):
setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.description: Instructions for using alternative browser for runtime, title

setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.message: Download the "portable" archive (binary tarball) for your preferred Firefox-based browser.
setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.description: Instructions for using alternative browser for runtime, step 1

setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.message: Extract downloaded archive and copy files to the correct directory (see below).
setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.description: Instructions for using alternative browser for runtime, step 2

setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.message: Inside that directory, symlink the main binary of your browser (for example, <kbd>librewolf.exe</kbd>/<kbd>librewolf-bin</kbd>) as <kbd>firefox.exe</kbd>/<kbd>firefox</kbd>.
setupPageAdvancedOptionsAlternativeBrows.description: Instructions for using alternative browser for runtime, step 3

setupPageAdvancedOptionsOverlayTitle.message: Linking the global Firefox installation with FUSE OverlayFS:
setupPageAdvancedOptionsOverlayTitle.description: Instructions for linking the runtime with FUSE OverlayFS, title

setupPageAdvancedOptionsOverlayStep1.message: Instructions are available on the documentation website.
setupPageAdvancedOptionsOverlayStep1.description: Instructions for linking the runtime with FUSE OverlayFS, step 1

setupPageDefaultRuntimeLocationTitle.description: The title for the default runtime locations section

setupPageReady.message: 此擴充套件已准備備妥，您可以關閉此頁面。
setupPageReady.description: The ready notice on the setup page

updatePageExtensionCompatible.message: It is compatible with the current connector version, but it is strongly recommended to update it to get the latest features and fixes.
updatePageExtensionCompatible.description: Displayed on the update page when the extension is compatible

updatePageExtensionIncompatible.message: It is not compatible with the current connector version, so you cannot use the extension until you update it.
updatePageExtensionIncompatible.description: Displayed on the update page when the extension is incompatible

updatePageExtensionInstructions.message: Please update it from the Firefox addon manager (<kbd>about:addons</kbd>).
updatePageExtensionInstructions.description: Displayed on the update page nstruct users to follow the instructions to update the extension

updatePageUpdated.message: The extension and the native connector are updated to the same version. You can close this page.

updatePageReleaseNotes.message: You can read the release notes for a list of new features, bug fixes and other improvements.

updatePageReleaseNotesIncompatible.message: This update may contain backward-incompatible changes, so you may also need to re-configure some things as specified in the release notes to make it work.

instructionsPageSourceInstallNotice2.message: If you want to package PWAsForFirefox for your distribution or have already packaged it, please let me know, so I can help with the packaging and list it in the installation instructions. If the packaging platform supports any auto-submission/uploading feature, please also let me know, as I might integrate it directly with GitHub Actions to make sure the packages are always up-to-date.
instructionsPageSourceInstallNotice2.description: The notice for packaging the project for the source installation option

instructionsPageOtherInstallNotice.message: Your operating system is not officially supported. You can try building and installing the project from source with instructions from the source installation section. You may need to adjust them to make it work with your operating system, and there is no guarantee that it will work.

managePageProfileListUnnamed.description: The unnamed profile on the profile list

managePageProfileListCount.description: The web app count in the profile, supports limited pluralization options

managePageSettingsDisplayPageAction.description: The setting for displaying page action (address bar widget)

managePageSettingsDisplayPageActionValid.message: 在有效的漸進網頁應用程式上
managePageSettingsDisplayPageActionValid.description: The option to display page action on valid web apps

managePageSettingsDisplayPageActionAlway.description: The option to always display page action

managePageSettingsDisplayPageActionNever.description: The option to never display page action

managePageSettingsLaunchCurrentURL.message: Launch web apps on active URLs
managePageSettingsLaunchCurrentURL.description: The setting for launching web apps on active URLs

managePageSettingsShowUpdatePopup.message: 在擴充套件更新時察看彈窗
managePageSettingsShowUpdatePopup.description: The setting for showing update popups

managePageSettingsEnableAutoLaunch.message: 啟用自動啟動網頁應用
managePageSettingsEnableAutoLaunch.description: The setting for enabling automatic launching

managePageSettingsAlwaysPatch.message: 總是修補執行環境和配置檔案

managePageSettingsEnablePortals.description: The setting for enabling XDG Desktop Portals (Linux-only)

managePageSettingsDarkMode.description: The setting for enabling dark mode

managePageSettingsDarkModeTooltip.message: 只能在系統設定中啟用
managePageSettingsDarkModeTooltip.description: The tooltip for the dark mode setting

managePageSettingsDefaultProfileTemplate.description: The setting for default profile template

managePageSettingsAutoLaunchExclusion.description: The setting for auto launch exclusion

managePageSettingsAutoLaunchExclusionPla.message: Enter a regex of excluded URLs
managePageSettingsAutoLaunchExclusionPla.description: The placeholder for auto launch exclusion

managePageSettingsUpdateWebApps.description: The button in settings to update web apps

managePageSettingsPatchProfiles.message: 修補配置檔案和執行環境
managePageSettingsPatchProfiles.description: The button in settings to patch profiles and runtime

managePageSettingsReinstallRuntime.description: The button in settings to reinstall runtime

managePageSettingsAboutProject.description: The button in settings to display project info

managePageFooterOutdated1.description: The first part of the extension outdated warning

managePageFooterOutdated2.description: The second part of the extension outdated warning

managePageFooterSearchPlaceholder.description: The search placeholder for web apps and profiles

managePageAppEditLaunchOnWebsiteLabel.message: 在符合的網站上啟動相應網頁應用
managePageAppEditLaunchOnWebsiteLabel.description: The label for the launch on website checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditLaunchOnWebsiteTooltip.message: Determines if web app will be automatically launched when visiting the matching website
managePageAppEditLaunchOnWebsiteTooltip.description: The tooltip for the launch on website checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditLaunchOnLoginLabel.message: Launch this web app on system login
managePageAppEditLaunchOnLoginLabel.description: The label for the launch on login checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditLaunchOnLoginTooltip.message: Determines if web app will be automatically launched on the system login
managePageAppEditLaunchOnLoginTooltip.description: The tooltip for the launch on login checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditLaunchOnBrowserLabel.message: Launch this web app on browser launch
managePageAppEditLaunchOnBrowserLabel.description: The label for the launch on browser checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditLaunchOnBrowserTooltip.message: Determines if web app will be automatically launched on the browser launch
managePageAppEditLaunchOnBrowserTooltip.description: The tooltip for the launch on browser checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditUpdateManifestLabel.description: The label for the manifest update checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditUpdateManifestTooltip.message: Determines if manifest will be updated when you edit this web app
managePageAppEditUpdateManifestTooltip.description: The tooltip for the manifest update checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditUpdateIconsLabel.description: The label for the icons update checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppEditUpdateIconsTooltip.message: Determines if icons will be updated when you edit this web app
managePageAppEditUpdateIconsTooltip.description: The tooltip for the icons update checkbox on the edit web app dialog

managePageAppRemoveQuestion.message: 您確定要移除此網頁應用嗎？
managePageAppRemoveQuestion.description: The confirmation question on the remove web app dialog

managePageAppRemoveNotLast.message: Other apps are present in this profile, so the profile will not be removed. The app data will remain, but you can remove them through the app browser or by deleting the app's profile.
managePageAppRemoveNotLast.description: The additional clarification on the remove web app dialog if the web app is not the last in its profile

managePageAppRemoveLast.message: This is the last app in this profile, so you can choose to delete it and the associated app data.
managePageAppRemoveLast.description: The additional clarification on the remove web app dialog if the web app is the last in its profile

managePageAppRemoveCheckboxLabel.message: 移除配置檔案和應用資料
managePageAppRemoveCheckboxLabel.description: The label for the profile delete checkbox on the remove web app dialog

managePageAppRemoveCheckboxTooltip.message: Determines if the current app profile and data will be deleted while uninstalling the app
managePageAppRemoveCheckboxTooltip.description: The label for the profile delete checkbox on the remove web app dialog

managePageProfileEditApplyProfileLabel.description: The label for the apply template checkbox on the edit profile dialog

managePageProfileRemoveQuestion.message: Are you sure you want to remove this profile? This will completely remove the profile and all associated web apps, including their data. You might not be able to fully recover this action.
managePageProfileRemoveQuestion.description: The confirmation question on the remove profile dialog

managePageProfileRemoveDefault.message: Default profile cannot be completely removed. Web apps and data will be cleared, but the profile will stay.
managePageProfileRemoveDefault.description: The additional clarification on the remove profile dialog if this is the default profile

managePageAutoLaunchTitle.description: The title of the automatic launching dialog

managePageAutoLaunchAboutMain.message: Enabling automatic web app launching will automatically launch all URLs that match the scopes of your enabled web apps as a web app.
managePageAutoLaunchAboutMain.description: The main clarification about the automatic launching

managePageAutoLaunchAboutExperimental.message: This feature is experimental, may not work with all websites correctly, and may impact performance. It needs to be additionally enabled per web app in the web app settings using the $OPTION$ option.
managePageAutoLaunchAboutExperimental.description: The experimental clarification about the automatic launching

option.example: Launch this web app on matching website

managePageAutoLaunchAboutPermissions.message: Additional browser permissions are required for this to work. They will be requested automatically after enabling it if they are not already permitted.
managePageAutoLaunchAboutPermissions.description: The permissions clarification about the automatic launching

managePageAutoLaunchEnable.description: The enable button for the automatic launching

managePageUpdateWebAppsAbout1.message: This will download and parse manifests for all your web apps and register them again to the operating systems. Any changes in web app manifests will also be reflected on your system.
managePageUpdateWebAppsAbout1.description: The first part of about updating web apps message

managePageUpdateWebAppsAbout2.message: Alternatively, you can register all web apps to the operating system without performing any manifest updates. This can be used if you transferred your config file from another device.
managePageUpdateWebAppsAbout2.description: The second part of about updating web apps message

managePageUpdateWebAppsManifest.description: The checkbox label for performing manifest updates when updating web apps

managePagePatchProfilesAbout1.message: This will patch all profiles and runtime with the current globally installed version.
managePagePatchProfilesAbout1.description: The first part of about patching profiles and runtime message

managePagePatchProfilesAbout2.message: This is useful after (re)installing a custom runtime, or if you are experiencing problems with web app launching.
managePagePatchProfilesAbout2.description: The second part of about patching profiles and runtime message

managePagePatchProfilesPatchRuntime.description: The checkbox label for patching runtime when patching profiles and runtime

managePagePatchProfilesPatchProfiles.description: The checkbox label for patching profiles when patching profiles and runtime

managePageReinstallRuntimeAbout1.message: 您確定要重新下載PWAsForFirefox執行環境嗎？這將移除目前的執行環境并從Mozilla下載最新版本。
managePageReinstallRuntimeAbout1.description: The first part of about reinstalling runtime message

managePageReinstallRuntimeAbout2.message: 這不會影響您的Firefox瀏覽器，也不會移除任何配置檔案等資料。
managePageReinstallRuntimeAbout2.description: The second part of about reinstalling runtime message

buttonRuntimeInstallDefault.description: The runtime installation button on the setup page, allowing the user to install the runtime

buttonRuntimeInstallProcessing.description: The runtime installation button on the setup page, while the runtime is installing

buttonRuntimeInstallFinished.description: The runtime installation button on the setup page, after the runtime has been installed

buttonWebAppInstallDefault.description: The web app button on the install web app page, allowing the user to install the web app

buttonWebAppInstallProcessing.description: The web app installation button on the install web app page, while the web app is installing

buttonWebAppInstallFinished.description: The web app installation button on the install web app page, after the web app has been installed

buttonCreateDefault.description: The create button, allowing the user to create something (profile)

buttonCreateProcessing.description: The create button, while something (profile) is being created

buttonCreateFinished.description: The create button, after something (profile) has been created

buttonEditDefault.description: The edit button, allowing the user to edit something (web app or profile)

buttonEditProcessing.description: The edit button, while something (web app or profile) is being edited

buttonEditFinished.description: The edit button, after something (web app or profile) has been edited

buttonRemoveDefault.description: The remove button, allowing the user to remove something (web app or profile)

buttonRemoveProcessing.description: The remove button, while something (web app or profile) is being removed

buttonRemoveFinished.description: The remove button, after something (web app or profile) has been removed

buttonUpdateDefault.description: The update button, allowing the user to update something (all web apps)

buttonUpdateProcessing.description: The update button, while something (all web apps) is being updated

buttonUpdateFinished.description: The update button, after something (all web apps) has been updated

buttonPatchDefault.description: The patch button, allowing the user to patch something (all web apps or profiles)

buttonPatchProcessing.description: The patch button, while something (all web apps or profiles) is being patched

buttonPatchFinished.description: The patch button, after something (all web apps or profiles) has been patched

buttonReinstallDefault.description: The reinstall button, allowing the user to reinstall something (runtime)

buttonReinstallProcessing.description: The reinstall button, while something (runtime) is being reinstalled

buttonReinstallFinished.description: The reinstall button, after something (runtime) has been reinstalled
